header.title: Your Loginus ID
header.description: Many Loginus services are only available after registration: for example, without an account you won't be able to use many features. Loginus ID is a unified account on Loginus. Use it to authorize on all Loginus services.
header.description2: If you need to change your password or specify a different last name, just update the information in Loginus ID. Changes will automatically appear in all services. Here you can also link a phone number to Loginus ID and configure the login method.

additionalHelp.title: Didn't find the answer?
additionalHelp.description: If you didn't find the answer to your question in the help section, contact support.

authorization.title: Login to Loginus
authorization.intro: To work with Loginus personal services (Mail, Disk, etc.), log in to your account using one of the following methods:

methods.password: enter your login and password on the service
methods.qr: scan QR code in Loginus app
methods.biometric: set up face recognition or fingerprint
methods.phone: enter phone number on any Loginus service
methods.keyQr: scan QR code or enter one-time password
methods.keyPassword: enter permanent password, then use one-time password from Loginus Key or another app based on TOTP RFC algorithm, or scan QR code in Loginus Key app

sections.foreignPc: How to safely log into Loginus on someone else's device

setAuthMethods.intro: You can choose how to log into your account:
setAuthMethods.step2: In the Login method section, click on the current login method and select:
setAuthMethods.passwordSmsDesc: more secure than password login. To log in, you'll need to enter your password first, then a code from SMS, push notification code, or the last 6 digits of incoming number. This way, even if someone knows your password, they won't be able to access your account without access to your phone.
setAuthMethods.passwordOtpDesc: the most reliable method. To log in, you'll need to enter your regular password first, then a one-time password from Loginus Key app or another app based on TOTP RFC algorithm.
setAuthMethods.passwordDesc: the simplest. Just enter your password to log in. Not secure, as someone who knows your password can easily access your account.
setAuthMethods.step3: If needed, enable auxiliary methods that don't require password entry:
setAuthMethods.qr: Login using QR code from Loginus app.
setAuthMethods.picture: Login by picture from Loginus Key.

cannotAuth.intro: If you see the message "Sorry, this login is taken", you might be on the registration page or already logged into an account registered through the simplified system without a login.
cannotAuth.steps: To log into an account with a login:
cannotAuth.step2: Check that Caps Lock is not active and English layout is selected.
cannotAuth.step3: In the Login or email field, enter your login and click Login. If you don't have a Login or email field, click More → Login with login → enter your login in the Login or email field and click Login.
cannotAuth.step4: Enter your account password and click Login again.
cannotAuth.phone: If when logging in by phone number you don't see the profile you need in the account list, try finding it by name. To do this, click No matching profile → Find by first and last name. If it doesn't work right away, try different spelling variations.
cannotAuth.loginPhone: If you can't log in using phone number to an account that has a login on Loginus:
cannotAuth.loginPhoneStep1: Log into the account with your login and password. You can do this in a browser, on the authorization page, or in a search app, such as Loginus Start or Loginus — with Alice.
cannotAuth.loginPhoneStep2: After authorization, confirm your phone number on the confirmation page. Now you'll be able to log into your account using your phone number.

foreignPc.intro: When you've logged into Loginus, you'll only need to enter your password again on this device if you don't access Loginus services for three months or more. This is convenient for a personal or home computer, but dangerous on public computers (e.g., in internet cafes): if you forget to log out, the next person using the same computer will have access to your data.
foreignPc.incognito: To secure your account on someone else's computer, use incognito mode in your browser.
foreignPc.noIncognito: If the computer doesn't have a browser that supports incognito mode:
foreignPc.disableAutofill: Disable form autofill and password saving.
foreignPc.clearCache: Before starting work, clear cache and delete cookie files.
foreignPc.logout: Log out of your account — click your portrait in the top right corner and select Log out from the dropdown menu.
foreignPc.clearAgain: Clear cache and delete cookie files again.
foreignPc.forgot: If you forgot to log out of your account on someone else's device, go to Log out on all devices link in the Devices section and set a new password that's hard to guess.
